intro: Lastrea flaccida, commonly known as the flaccid lastrea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, also known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are usually pink or violet, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens.
